revised_title: Observations on the Villi of the Stomach of Oxen and the Expansion of the Cuticle through the Ductus Alimentalis
tldr: Charles Price's letter describes his observations on the villi of the oxen's stomach and the expansion of the cuticle through the ductus alimentalis. He examines the structure of the villi and suggests that they may be similar in humans. He also notes the presence of a cuticle production covering the internal surface of the stomach, which he believes is present in both humans and large animals.
